title: HDFC Bank will "break-out" from slow loan growth period
description: India's largest private lender HDFC Bank experienced an adjustment period that might slow credit growth, said MD Sashidhar Jagdishan. The bank aimed to reduce its credit-to-deposit ratio by focusing on higher deposit growth. Advances grew by 52.6% annually, with deposits rising 24.4%. Jagdishan emphasized the bank's strategy benefits in a changing business cycle.
